Constant voltage with a control system (PI controller)

Requires shorting of PV array to measure Isc
Second identical cell needed to measure Voc, partial shading issues
FOCV with temperature taken into account

column3: Measure temperature and irrdiance to calculate Vmpp, consider parameters based on panel datasheet
PN junction diodes mounted on the back of panels, measure temperature and used to determine Vmpp reference voltage directly

column2: Conventional P&O with fixed perturbation step
column3: Vpv is perturbed and then converted to duty cycle with PI controller, step size is fixed and user determined

column2: Modified P & O with fixed perturbation step
column3: Direct perturbation of duty cycle, no PI control required, step size is fixed and user determined

column2: Conventional P & O with adaptive perturbation
column3: Vpv is perturbed and then converted to duty cycle with PI controller, step size is steadily decreased as the system gets closer to Vmpp
Direct perturbation of duty cycle, no PI control required, step size determined by variation in power with respect to duty cycle (dP/dD)
Like P&O but the voltage is perturbed in both directions, the signs of both directions are used to determine the operating point
Won't work if the load is too small
Duty cycle is perturbed and PV current measured
Only for large PV systems
Power-Current curves measured for varying irrdiance, the linear intersection of those curves is used to determine MPP
Large system memory for storing values
Assumes that the DC-DC converter is lossless
Like CV, but temperature and irrdiance are measured
Exponential sweep is used to find the V-I characteristic at varying time intervals
Intermediate variable B that takes into account panel characteristics is used to find the search range for another MPPT method
Calculate variation of power with respect to voltage, perturb the voltage similar to P&O
Same as IC expect the step size is based on the distance from MPP
Same as previous expect step size is determined by an exponential threshold function, C = P^n*abs(dP/dI)
Uses the ripple introduced by the power converter to track the MPP, the time derivatives of the PV array current and voltage are driven to zero
Ripple is injected into power converter, the phase between the voltage and power is used to find MPP
Calculate dP/dV or dP/dI and use controller to drive it to zero, the signs of the past few cycles are used to determine the duty cycle
Vmpp computed using irrdiance and temperature, feedback control used to make the panel operate at Vmpp
No existing hardware implementation or experiementation
Variation of power with respect to voltage used to determine switching state of MOSFET
Samples power, voltage and current, attempts to constantly calculate the PV curve using polynomials coefficients determined by panel specs
Time dervatives of power, voltage and current are solved to find MPP
Requires measurement of Voc and Isc
Several parallel connected PV modules needed
Inputs Change in Voltage and Power to output duty cycle based on a set of membership functions (rules)

A neural network has 3 layers: input, hidden, and output. The input variables to the MPPT system include Voc, Isc, temperature and irrandiance. In the hidden layer, different weights are assigned to each variable in a process called training. The network then produces an Impp and Vmpp at the output layer.

The behavior of the Cuckoo bird's social behavior is used to find the MPP. At a very basic level, it determines the probability of a cuckoo egg hatching and the host bird returning to the nest. A special fitness function is used to to fine tune the PV array operating voltage and step size.

As an analogy to a flock of birds, particles are randomly placed along the I-V curve. The particles' objective is to converge at MPPT point using velocity and position equations that use individual and global power values of the particles to find point of convergence.
Uses the leadership hierarchy and chasing mechanism of grey wolves. This algorithm is more indepent of the PV array characteristics.

Involves a greedy search algorithm, positive feedback mechanism and distributed computing. The positive feedback helps in identifying the best optimal MPP while the distributed computing encourages the algorithm to stay away from premature convergence.

Honey bees search for food by dividing themselves into groups. The groups used in the algorithm are employed, onlooker and scouts. If the number of employed bees is more abundant in the group, the better the performance.

Gauss and Newton techniques used to solve nonlinear problems associated with the least square approximation. In one separate methods, a second derivative needs to be calculated, however the combined technique breaks the MPP function into a vector based model (regression function) and a scalar value loss (error between anticipated output and target value).

Fibonacci Series  limits search range. It constantly shifts the range around based on the success of the previous iteration. The range constantly decreases (according to the Fibonacci sequence) until the MPP is reached.
Uses the particle swarm method to simplify and optimize the base values for fuzzy logic membership function.
Combines ANN with FLC. The neural network used to tune the fuzzy logic membership functions.
Starts by searching for the MPP using GWO. Once smaller search space found, the P&O method fine tunes the MPP.
Uses P&O to determine local MPP, then global MPP is found using the PSO technique.
Combines a hill-climbing technique with  hybrid ANFIS technique. The ANFIS algorithm calculates the duty cycle independent of system, sends information to the hc controller which fines tunes the MPP.
